alert.note: Alert for Hayes (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 2:31AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Chase and southern Hayes Counties through 315 AM CDT/215 AM MDT/... At 231 AM CDT/131 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wauneta, or 16 miles southeast of Imperial, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wauneta and Hamlet. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT/300 AM MDT/ for southwestern Nebraska.
